page.title: 14HISTORIC HOME MINCHINHAMPTON
page.content: Rose Cottage, Amberley, is wrongly thought to be the home of{Mrs. Craik} who wrote{John Halifax, Gentleman}- a novel published in 1856, which was produced as a television series in the 1970's. The true facts are that years before her marriage to Mr George Craik in 1864, Mrs.Craik, who was then Miss Mulock, had stayed with friends in the Stroud area - perhaps at Rose Cottage. In the book she describes Rose Cottage, and it is an important house in the story. It was where John Halifax spent some of his early married life. He built up a succesful weaving business at Dunkirk Mills and finally died nearby.
